text:
The <untar> task does not properly restore the symbolic link from the tar. On 
Unix (I tried on Linux and SGI), I created a tar with a symbolic link in it. I 
can untar this file fine with "tar xvf <file.tar>" command but using <untar> 
command, the links are created as regular files with 0 (zero) size.
creator: s.jain@gtisoft.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
I guess you are aware of the fact that Java doesn't know about symlinks at all.

It may be possible to check whether ln is available as a command and execute
it if a symbolic link inside the archive is encountered, that's why I didn't
close this report as WONTFIX right away.

If you want to take a stab at it, look into the new <symlink> task in Ant's
CVS repository to get an idea of what is involved here.

creator: gus.heck@olin.edu
text: You may also want to note bug 15244, and read the old bug 1550.
